Name: lasalle college of the arts
Opening_hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 12pm - 7pm, Closed on Monday and public holidays
Description: Housed in a tertiary arts college, the Institute of Contemporary Arts Singapore will help you deepen your appreciation for experimental artworks.

Name: old supreme court
Description: Due to reopen as the National Gallery Singapore, the Old Supreme Court is in itself a masterpiece of classical art.

Name: sit flats
Description: The Art Deco elegance of the flats in Tiong Bahru speak of the richness of a vanished world.

Name: lau pa sat
Description: The historic market Lau Pa Sat offers a winning combination of graceful colonial architecture, a longstanding heritage and delicious food.

Name: pinnacle at duxton
Description: With its lofty towers and dizzying sky gardens, the Pinnacle at Duxton takes residential living to soaring new heights.

Name: hajjah fatimah mosque
Description: With its tilting European-style minaret and Chinese tiling, the Hajjah Fatimah Mosque is one of the most unique mosques in Singapore.

Name: haw par villa
Description: A visit to the Haw Par Villa theme park is an unforgettable journey into Chinese folklore and mythology.

Name: nus baba house
Opening_hours: Visits are by appointment only.Visitors must sign up in advance for heritage tours which fall on:Monday, 2pm _ 3pm,Tuesday, 6.30pm _ 7.30pm,Thursday, 10am _ 11am,Saturday, 11am _ 12pm
Description: NUS Baba House is a heritage house that gives a rich look at Singapore's Peranakan community, thanks to beautifully preserved architecture and artefacts.

Name: hong san see
Description: Dancing dragons and prancing phoenixes are just some of the visual delights to catch at the exquisitely restored Hong San See temple.

Name: malay heritage centre
Opening_hours: Malay Heritage Centre Museum, Tuesday to Sunday, 10am _ 6pm, Closed on Monday, Malay Heritage Centre Compound, Tuesday to Sunday, 8am _ 8pm, Friday and Saturday, 8am _ 10pm, Closed on Monday
Description: The Malay Heritage Centre is a must-visit if you??re keen on learning about the rich heritage and culture of Singapore??s Malay community.

Name: peranakan museum
Description: At the Peranakan Museum, get to know Singapore??s vibrant Peranakan community and its eclectic culture and history with fun and interactive exhibits.

Name: raffles hotel
Description: Sip a Singapore Sling beneath the whirling fans at the Long Bar, and let the tranquil charms of Raffles Singapore bring you back into another era.

Name: gillman barracks
Opening_hours: Tuesday to Saturday, 11am - 7pm, Sunday, 11am - 6pm , Galleries closed on Monday and public holidays.
Description: Gillman Barracks Singapore is Asia??s vibrant new destination for the creation, exhibition and discussion of contemporary art.

Name: chinatown heritage centre
Opening_hours: Daily, 9am _ 8pm,Last entry at 7pm.*Chinatown Heritage Centre will be closed for renovation from 1 October 2014 till end-2015.
Description: At the Chinatown Heritage Centre, experience how Singapore??s early Chinese migrants once lived and learn more about local Chinese culture.

Name: thian hock keng temple
Description: Thian Hock Keng Temple is the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and dedicated to Mazu, the Goddess of the Sea.

Name: eurasian heritage centre
Opening_hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 9am _ 6pm, Closed on Monday
Description: This engaging heritage attraction takes you through the history and culture of the Eurasian community in Singapore.

Name: shophouses typology
Description: Few buildings epitomise our culture as fully as the shophouse, with its surprisingly harmonious mix of diverse design elements.

Name: capitol building singapore
Description: Now undergoing massive restoration works, Capitol Building will emerge as Singapore??s premier entertainment hub next year.

Name: esplanade theatres on the bay
Opening_hours: Box Office Opening Hours Daily, 12pm _ 8.30pm, The Esplanade Box Office will open 1 hour prior to show commencement for shows before 12 noon and will remain open up to half an hour after show commencement for shows starting after 8.30pm.
Description: Esplanade Theatres on the Bay is the country??s premier arts centre as well as an iconic landmark on the city??s skyline.

Name: gardens by the bay
Opening_hours: Bay South Outdoor Gardens Daily, 5am - 2am Cooled Conservatories and OCBC Skyway Daily, 9am - 9pm(last ticket sale at 8pm).Far East Organization Children's Garden Tuesday* to Friday, 10am - 7pm(last admission: 6.30pm)*Closed on Tuesday if a public holiday falls on the preceding Monday Weekends and public holidays, 9am - 9pm(last admission: 8.30pm)

Name: the interlace
Description: Few buildings demonstrate out-of-the-box thinking as well as The Interlace, an intriguingly designed residential complex.

Name: parkroyal on pickering
Description: PARKROYAL on Pickering is a luxurious garden oasis in downtown Singapore.

Name: national museum of singapore
Opening_hours: Singapore History Gallery Daily, 10am _ 6pm,Last admission at 5.30pm.Singapore Living Galleries Daily, 10am _ 8pm Free admission from 6pm _8pm , Last admission at 7.30pm
Description: The National Museum of Singapore is a progressive showcase of the country??s history and culture.

Name: japanese cemetery park
Description: The Japanese Cemetery Park is the largest Japanese cemetery in Southeast Asia, containing nearly 1,000 graves of Singapore??s early Japanese community.

Name: dalhousie obelisk
Description: Dalhousie Obelisk at Empress Place is a famous architectural landmark in Singapore.

Name: sir raffles statue landing site
Description: Raffles Statue depicts the founder of modern Singapore, Sir Stamford Raffles. Two statues exist today, at the Raffles Landing Site and Empress Place.

Name: philatelic museum
Description: The Philatelic Museum offers visitors postage stamp-sized windows into Singapore and the rest of the world.

Name: memories at ford factory
Description: The Old Ford Factory is a repository of memories about the hardships endured during the Japanese Occupation of Singapore.

Name: singapore coins notes museum
Description: The Singapore Coins and Notes Museum tells the story of Singapore through the currencies it has used over the years.

Name: singapore city gallery
Description: The Singapore City Gallery tells the story of the city??s physical transformation.

Name: changi museum
Description: Changi Museum provides an emotional exploration of Singapore??s wartime history during the Japanese Occupation.

Name: mint musuem of toys
Description: Singapore's MINT Museum of Toys' vast collection of vintage toys will delight both kids and adults.

Name: lim bo seng memorial
Description: The gazetted Lim Bo Seng Memorial at Esplanade Park commemorates one of Singapore??s heroes from World War II.

Name: kranji war memorial

Name: indian national army monument

Name: reflections at bukit chandu
Opening_hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 9am _ 5.30pm,Closed on Monday (except on public holidays)
Description: Reflections at Bukit Chandu relives the Battle of Pasir Panjang, one of the fiercest battles fought against the Japanese in Singapore during World War II.

Name: cenotaph

Name: civilian war memorial
Description: The Civilian War Memorial and park in Beach Road commemorates Singapore??s civilian victims of the Japanese Occupation during World War II.

Name: sri veeramakaliamman temple
Description: Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple is one of Singapore??s oldest Hindu temples, in the heart of Little India.

Name: maghain aboth synagogue
Opening_hours: Visits are available only by appointment. For more information, email jewishwb@singnet.com.sg or call +65 6337 2189 (ext. 103)
Description: The simple exterior of the Maghain Aboth Synagogue gives no indication of its richly elegant interiors.

Name: sultan mosque
Description: The impressive Sultan Mosque (also known as Masjid Sultan) in historic Kampong Glam is the focal point for Singapore??s Muslim community.

Name: sri mariamman temple
Description: Sri Mariamman Temple, located in Chinatown, is the oldest Hindu temple in Singapore.

Name: armenian church
Description: The Armenian Church is the oldest Christian church in Singapore and an architectural masterpiece from the early 19th century.

Name: chijmes
Opening_hours: Daily, 24 hours,Opening hours of businesses in CHIJMES may vary.
Description: Who would have thought a former school would make such a graceful transition? As a lifestyle and entertainment complex, CHIJMES soars high above the rest.

Name: st andrews cathedral
Description: Singapore's largest cathedral is a stellar example of colonial-era architecture and heritage.

Name: artscience museum
Description: Catch world-class touring exhibitions at this premier exhibition space.

Name: chinese heritage centre
Opening_hours: Monday to Friday, 9.30am _ 5pm,Saturday and Sunday, 10am _5pm, Closed on public holidays
Description: The Chinese Heritage Centre in Singapore is where you can find out more about overseas Chinese communities and their culture.

Name: kampong glam
Description: Discover Kampong Glam's rich history, living traditions, excellent eateries and trendy shops in this vibrant neighbourhood.

Name: centre for contemporary art
Opening_hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 12pm _ 7pm Friday, 12pm _ 9pm , Closed on Monday. Open on public holiday.
Description: This university arts research centre explores contemporary art through exhibitions, public programmes, residencies and research programmes.

Name: the substation
Opening_hours: The Substation Box Office ,Monday to Friday, 12pm - 2pm and 5pm - 8pm.Saturday and Sunday, open an hour prior to weekend showtimes. Closed on public holidays.The Substation Gallery Daily, 12pm _ 9pm Closed on public holidays
Description: This experimental arts centre gives a space for contemporary artists to try out new concepts.

Name: red dot design museum
Opening_hours: Monday - Friday, 11am _ 6 pm, Saturday and Sunday, 11am _ 8 pm
Description: This museum holds more than 1,000 award-winning products, communications and concepts that will delight design fans.

Name: singapore art museum
Description: Singapore Art Museum is Singapore??s contemporary art museum, focused on Southeast Asian contemporary art.

Name: national design centre
Description: The National Design Centre is the nexus for all things design. It hosts design exhibitions, events and programmes that will quicken the pulse of design lovers.

Name: victoria theatre concert hall
Description: After a four-year refurbishment, the Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall has since reopened, with its first official concert held there in August 2014.

Name: nus museum
Description: Get a deeper insight into Asian art and artefacts at this museum on the campus of the National University of Singapore.

Name: sun yat sen memorial hall
Opening_hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 10am _ 5pm, Closed on Monday
Description: This revamped museum is a fitting tribute to the intriguing life and times of Chinese revolutionary leader Dr Sun Yat Sen.

Name: asian civilizations museum
Description: Housed in a historical building by the Singapore River, this museum tells the stories of Asian civilisations through its permanent collections.

Name: resorts world sentosa
Opening_hours: Opening hours differ for the various attractions.
Description: Experience endless excitement at Resorts World Sentosa with a variety of attractions and entertainment hot spots.

Name: the southern ridges
Description: This 10-km stretch of connecting trails lets you walk among the trees to observe a wide variety of flora and fauna in their natural habitat.

Name: sungei buloh wetland reserve
Description: This ecological wonder will transport you into a world rich in animal and plant life.

Name: sea aquarium
Opening_hours: Open daily at 10am.Closing time varies. Please visit the official website for more information.
Description: Immerse yourself underwater at the S.E.A. Aquarium? and discover more than 100,000 marine animals.

Name: singapore botanic gardens
Opening_hours: Singapore Botanic Gardens Daily, 5am - 12am National Orchid Garden Daily, 8.30am - 7pm(last ticket sales at 6pm)Jacob Ballas Children's Garden Tuesday to Sunday, 8am - 7pm(last admission: 6.30pm)Closed every Monday (except when it falls on a designated public holiday)SBG Heritage MuseumDaily*, 9am - 6pm*Closed every last Monday of the month (except when it falls on a designated public holiday, it will be closed the following day)
Description: Singapore??s oldest garden is a treasure trove for plant lovers, or those who simply want to have a good time outdoors.

Name: singapore zoo
Description: Singapore??s zoo is a beautiful, award-winning wildlife park, where animals can roam freely in their natural habitats.

Name: river safari singapore
Description: At the River Safari Singapore, meet manatees and monkeys, piranhas and pandas, as they congregate in and around the park??s waters.

Name: mount faber
Description: Getting to this hilltop dining and entertainment spot at Mount Faber by cable car  is half the fun.

Name: night safari
Opening_hours: Daily, 7.30pm - 12am .Last ticket sale at 11.15pm.F and B and retail outlets open from 5.30pm
Description: Instead of going to a club, pop into another popular nightspot, the Night Safari, and mingle with a different crowd of animals at this special zoo.

Name: pulau ubin
Description: Gravel roads, lush forests and abundant wildlife _ Pulau Ubin is a living showcase of what Singapore was like in the 1960s.

Name: little india
Description: Little India is a buzzing historic area that shows off the best of Singapore??s Indian community from vibrant culture to incredible shopping.

Name: orchard
Description: Orchard Road, Asia??s most famous shopping street, is home to fashion favourites, specialist stores and loads of other lifestyle choices.

Name: macritchie nature reserve
Description: The attractions around MacRitchie Reservoir is a playground of nature for those who love the outdoors.

Name: civic district
Description: The Civic District is where Singapore??s historical, architectural and cultural heritage started.

Name: harbourfront
Description: HarbourFront is the place to go if you're hopping on a cruise from Singapore, taking a regional ferry or simply want to eat, shop or relax.

Name: bras basah bugis
Description: The Bras Basah.Bugis Precinct is the arts and heritage district in Singapore's civic centre, and home to museums and monuments.

Name: sam at 8Q
Description: An extension of the Singapore Art Museum, SAM at 8Q features contemporary art exhibitions and is home to a Moving Image Gallery, where film screenings are held.

Name: jamae mosque
Description: Also known as Masjid Chulia, Jamae Mosque is one of Singapore??s oldest mosques and a prominent landmark in Chinatown since the 1820s.

Name: institute of contemporary arts
Opening_hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 12pm - 7pm, Closed on Monday and public holidays
Description: This experimental art space housed in a tertiary arts college will help you deepen your understanding of contemporary art.

Name: singapore flyer
Description: This giant observation wheel offers 360-degree city views, a panorama that stretches to parts of Malaysia and Indonesia on a clear day.

Name: marina barrage
Opening_hours: Marina Barrage - All day  Information Counter Daily, 9am _ 9pm
Description: This innovative facility not only supplies water to Singaporeans and helps alleviate floods but also doubles up as a place for family fun.

Name: henderson waves
Description: Lush jungle is broken up with a seriously creative twist in the fantastic form of the Henderson Waves bridge.

Name: abrador nature reserve
Description: With its rich biodiversity and war relics, nature lovers and history enthusiasts will find plenty to do at Labrador Nature Reserve.

Name: marina bay area
Description: Marina Bay represents all things modern and super-stylish, from trendy dining destinations to exciting leisure spots.

Name: marina bay sands
Description: The Marina Bay Sands<sup>_</sup> SkyPark is a roof like no other, perched 200 metres in the air with an infinity pool and observation deck in the clouds.

Name: chek jawa
Description: A world away from shopping malls and glitzy hotels, this natural wonder is one of Singapore??s richest eco-systems.

Name: merlion park
Description: Half-fish and half-lion, the iconic Merlion resides at the waterfront Merlion Park.

Name: marina bay sands skypark
Description: The Marina Bay Sands<sup>_</sup> SkyPark is a roof like no other, perched 200 metres in the air with an infinity pool and observation deck in the clouds.

Name: singapore river
Description: Get to know historic Singapore River and its famous quays: Boat Quay, Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay. After all, this is where it all began.

Name: joo chiat/katong
Description: Discover Peranakan culture as you stroll past heritage shophouses, quaint stores and eateries in this charming corner of eastern Singapore.

Name: sentosa
Description: Sentosa Island is Singapore??s favourite leisure destination with exciting attractions, golden beaches, luxe retreats and the country??s first integrated resort.

Name: chinatown
Description: Singapore??s historic Chinatown is a bustling mix of old and new, filled with traditional shops and markets as well as cool stores and cafes.

Name: buddha tooth relic temple museum
Description: This Tang-styled Chinese Buddhist temple in Chinatown gets its name from what the Buddhists regard as the Sacred Buddha Tooth Relic.

Name: national gallery singapore
Opening_hours: Effective from 24 November 2015, Sunday to Thursday and  public holidays,10am - 7pm ,Friday to Saturday and  eve of public holidays, 10am - 10pm
Description: Take in the region??s newest and largest museum of modern Singapore and Southeast Asian art housed within two of Singapore??s awe-inspiring national monuments.

Name: universal studios singapore
Opening_hours: Open daily at 10am.Closing time varies. Please visit the official website for more information.
Description: Step into the glamorous world of movies at this world-class theme park located within Resorts World Sentosa?.

Name: science centre
Opening_hours: Science Centre Singapore Daily, 10am _ 6pm(last admission: 5.15pm) .Omni Theatre Daily, 12pm _ 6pm (last show: 6pm) . Snow City Daily, 10am _ 6pm (last admission: 5pm) School and public holidays, 10am _ 7pm (last admission: 6pm)
Description: This enlightening attraction holds the largest collection of educational materials devoted to science in Singapore.

Name: fuk tak chi museum
Description: Fuk Tak Chi Museum was once the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and is an elegant example of restored architecture in Chinatown.

Name: katong antique house
Description: Step into this fully restored bona fide Peranakan family home, and admire the many antiques and heirlooms worthy of any museum collection.

Name: chinese garden
Description: A tranquil patch of imperial China in the west of Singapore is pleasant respite from the bustle of the city.

Name: east coast park
Description: With so many attractions packed into the 15-km stretch of beaches at East Coast Park, you??ll never run out of things to do.

Name: fort canning park
Description: Whether you??re a history buff, music fan or nature lover, this historic Fort Canning Park has something for everyone.

Name: kusu island
Description: Kusu Island lies to the south of Singapore, and has a wonderful mix of local heritage and beach activities.

Name: jurong bird park
Description: Jurong Bird Park has almost every species to impress avian lovers, along with fun exhibits, interactive shows, and of course, its charming residents.

Name: hortpark
Description: HortPark is a gorgeous collection of stunning gardens and plants that will make you  forget about the bustle of city.

Name: adventure cove
Description: Adventure Cove Waterpark? Singapore at Resorts World? Sentosa promises a day of wet and wild fun in the sun.

Name: lassalle college of the arts
Opening_hours: Administration Office Monday to Friday, 9am _ 6pm.Visitors can still walk around the campus after office opening hours.
Description: How can something that fits so perfectly into a cityscape evoke nature as well? It all lies in the design of Lasalle College of the Arts.
